info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:28AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River near Columbus.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
East Fork White River.
Muscatatuck River near Vernon.
.Significant and some major flooding is already occurring or expected to develop along the East Fork White River and its immediate tributaries in Shelby and Bartholomew Counties due to multiple rounds of heavy rainfall that have added up to 6 to 8 inches in the past week and additional rainfall is expected into Sunday morning. The crest on the East Fork should be in the Columbus Sunday morning and Seymour around Sunday night and points downstream thereafter.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, Major flood is in progress. Many evacuations from residential areas in flood plain are necessary. Portions of nearly 60 county and private roads are impassable, many by several feet of water. Many local river residents must park on high ground and boat out. Extensive damage occurs to local roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Saturday was 20.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 35.9 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 230 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
